subtitle: chapter 36 babajis interests in the West
Master did you ever meet Bemidji it was
a calm summer night in Serampore the
large stars and the tropics gleamed over
our heads I sat by Sri Yukteswar sign on
the second-story balcony of the
Hermitage
yes master smiled to my direct question
his eyes lit with reverence three times
I've been blessed by the sight of the
deathless guru our first meeting was in
all Halle Bob at the Kumbha Mela the
religious affairs held in India since
time immemorial are known as khumba
MELAS they have kept spiritual goals and
constant sight of the multitude devout
Hindus gathered by the millions every
six years to meet thousands sadhus
Yogi's Swami's and ascetics of all kinds
many are Hermits who never leave their
secluded haunts except to attend the
MELAS and bestow their blessings on
worldly men and women I was not a Swami
at the time I met Baba ji Sri Yukteswar
went on but I had already received kriya
initiation from larry masha he
encouraged me to attend the Mela which
was convening in January 1894 at
Allahabad it was my first experience of
a khumba I felt slightly dazed by the
clamour and surge of the crowd in my
searching gazes around
I saw no illumined face of a master
passing a bridge on the bank of the
Ganges I noticed an acquaintance tending
nearby his begging bowl extended
oh this is fares nothing but a can of
noise and beggars I thought in
disillusionment
I wondered if Western scientists
patiently enlarging the realm of
knowledge for the practical good of
mankind are not more pleasing to God
than these idlers who professed the
religion but concentrate on alms my
smoldering reflections on social reform
were interpreted by the voice of a tall
sannyasi who halted before me sir he
said a saint is calling you who is he
come and see for yourself hesitantly
following this laconic advice I soon
found myself near a tree whose branches
were sheltering a guru
with an attractive group of disciples
the master a bright unusual figure with
sparkling dark eyes Rose at my approach
and embraced me welcome Swamiji he said
affectionately sir I replied emphatic
Lee I am NOT a Swami those of whom I
divinely directed to bestow the title of
Swami never cast it off the Saint
addressed me simply but deep conviction
of truth rang in his words I was
engulfed in an instant wave of spiritual
blessing smiling at my sudden elevation
into the ancient monastic order I bowed
at the feet of the obviously great and
angelic being in human form who had thus
honored me
Babaji for twas indeed he motioned me to
sit near him under the tree he was
strong and young and looked like Larry
Masha yet the resemblance did not strike
me even though I had often heard of the
extraordinary similarities and the
appearance of two masters Babaji
possesses the power by which he can
prevent any specific thoughts from
arising in a person's mind evidently the
great guru wished me to be perfectly
natural in his present not over awed by
knowledge identity what do you think of
the Kumbha Mela I was greatly
disappointed sir I said hastily up until
the time I met you
somehow Saints in this commotion don't
seem to belong together
child the master said though apparently
I was nearly twice his own age for the
faults of the many judge not the whole
everything on earth is a mixture of
character like a mingling of sand and
sugar be like the wise ant which seizes
only the sugar and leaves the sand
untouched though many sadhus here still
wander Andalusian yet the mela is
blessed by a few men of God realization
in view of my own meeting with this
exalted master I quickly agreed with
observation sir I commented I have been
thinking the scientific men of the West
greater by far in intelligence than most
people congregated here living in
distant Europe and America professing
different Creed's and ignorant to the
real values of such mela as the present
one
they are the men who could benefit
greatly by meeting with India's masters
but although high and intellectual
attainment many Westerners are wedded to
rank materialism others famous and
science and philosophy do not recognize
the essential unity and religion their
creeds serve as insurmountable barriers
that threaten to separate them from us
forever I saw that you are interested in
the West as far as the East babajis face
beamed with approval
I felt the pangs of your heart brought
enough for all men whether oriental or
Occidental that is why I summoned you
here
East and West must established a golden
middle ground of activity and
spirituality combined he continued India
has much to learn from the West's
material development in return India can
teach the universal method by which the
West will be able to pass its religious
beliefs on the unshakable foundation of
yogic science you Swami ji have a part
to play in the coming harmonious
exchange between orient and oxidant some
years hence I shall send you disciple
whom you can trained for yoga and
dissemination the West the vibrations
there of many spiritually seeking Souls
come flood like to me I perceive
potential saints in American Europe
waiting to be awakened at this point in
a story Sri Yukteswar turned his gaze
fully at mine my son he said smiling the
moonlight you are the disciple light
years ago baba ji promised to send me I
was happy to learn that baba ji had
directed my steps to Sri Yukteswar yet
it was hard for me to visualize myself
in the remote West away from my beloved
guru and the simple hermitage space baba
ji then spoke of the bhagavad-gita Sri
Yukteswar went on to my astonishment he
indicated by a few words of praise that
he was aware of the fact that I had read
an interpretation on various gita
chapters at my request Swamiji please
undertake another task the great master
said will you not write a book on the
underlying basic unity between
Christian and Hindu scriptures show by
parallel references that the inspired
sons of God have spoken the same truth
now obscured by men's sectarian
differences Maharaja I answered
definitely what a command shall I be
able to fulfill it Babaji laughed softly
my son why do you doubt he said we
surely indeed whose work is all of this
and who is a doer of all actions
whatever the Lord has made me say is
bound to materialize his truth I deem
myself empowered by the blessing of the
saint and agreed to write the book
feeling reluctantly that the bargain
hour had arrived I rose from my leaf
seat
do you know Lahiri the master inquired
he is a great soul isn't he tell him of
our meeting he then gave me a message
for Larry mascha after I had bowed
humbly and farewell the saint smiled
benignly when your book is finished I
shall pay you a visit he promised
goodbye for the present I left al-habib
following day and entrained for Banaras
reaching my gurus home I poured out the
story of the wonderful Saint at the
kumbhamela Oh didn't you recognize him
Larry mashes eyes were dancing with
laughter I see you couldn't for he
prevented you he is my incomparable guru
the celestial Babaji baba ji I repeated
austrack the yogi Christ baba ji the
invisible visible saviour baba ji oh if
I could just recall the past and be once
more in his presence to show my devotion
at his lotus feet
never mind Larry Masha said consoling me
he has promised to see you again guru
Deva the divine master asked me to give
you a message
tell her II said that the stored up
power for his life now runs low it is
nearly finished at my utterance of these
enigmatic words Larry Marcia's figure
trembled as though touched by lightning
current in an instant everything about
him fell silent his smiling countenance
turn incredibly Stern like a wooden
statue somber and immovable and seat
his body became colorless I was alarmed
and bewildered never in my life had I
seen his joy soul manifests that's awful
gravity the other disciples present
stared up riehen cently three hours past
and utter silence then Laura Masha
resumed his natural cheerful demeanor
and spoke affectionately to his chile's
everyone sighed in relief I realized by
my Master's reaction at babaji's message
had been an unmistakable signal by which
Larry Masha understood that his body
would soon be untended his awesome
silence proved that my guru had
instantly controlled his being cut his
last chord of attachment to the material
world and fled this everliving identity
and spirit babajis remark had been his
way of saying I shall ever be with you
though Babaji and Larry Masha were
omniscient and had no need of
communicating with each other through me
or any other intermediary the great ones
often condescend to play a part in the
human drama occasionally they transmit
their prophecies through messengers in
an ordinary way that the final
fulfillment of their word may infuse
greater divine faith in a wide circle of
men who later learned the story I soon
left Banaras and set to work in
Serampore on the scriptural writings
requested by baba ji Sri Yukteswar
commented no sooner had I begun my task
I was able to compose a poem dedicated
to the deathless guru the melodious
lines flowed effortlessly for my pen
though never before had I attempted
Sanskrit poetry in the quiet of night I
busied myself over the comparison of the
Bible and the scriptures of
sanatana-dharma
quoting the words of the Blessed Lord
Jesus I showed that his teaching were an
essence one with revelations of the
Vedas to my relief my book was finished
in a short time I realized that the
speedy blessing was due to the grace of
my param guru Maharaj the chapters first
appeared in the Sun Houston bond journal
later they were privately printed as a
book by one of my kitty aport disciples
the morning after I'd concluded my
literary efforts master continued I went
to the riot got here to bathe in the
Ganges that goth was deserted I stood
still for a while and joined the sunny
peace after a dip in the sparkling
waters I started for home the only sound
in the silence was out of my Ganges
drench cloth swish washing with every
step as I passed beyond the sight of the
large banyan tree near the riverbank a
strong impulse urged me to look back
there under the shade of the Banyan and
surrounded by a few disciples south the
great Babaji greetings Swami Jai the
beautiful voice of the master rang out
who has swords me I was not dreaming I
see you have successfully completed your
book as I promised I am here to thank
you with a fast beating heart I prostate
admire at his feet param guru ji said
imploringly will you and your cheetahs
not honor my nearby home with your
presence the supreme guru smiled
inclined no child he said we are people
who like the shelter of trees this spot
is quite comfortable please tarry a
while master I gazed entreated Lee at
him I shall be back at 1:00 through some
special sweetmeats when I returned in a
few minutes with a dish of delicacy lo
the lordly Banyan no longer sheltered
the celestial troupe I searched all
around the God but in my heart I knew
the little band had already fled Don
tharok winnings I was deeply hurt even
if we meet again I would not care to
talk to him I shared my self
he was unkind to leave me so suddenly
this was a wrath of love of course and
nothing more a few months later I
visited Larry Marsh in Banaras as I
entered his little parlor my guru smiled
in greeting welcome York - wari said did
you just meet Baba ji at the threshold
of my room why no I answered in surprise
come here Larry Masha touched me gently
on the forehead at once I beheld near
the door the form of Babaji blooming
like a perfect Lotus
I remembered my old hurt and did not bow
Larry Masha looked at me an astonishment
the divine guru gazed at me with
Fatima's eyes you are annoyed with me
sir why shouldn't I be he answered out
of the air you come with your magic
group and into the thin air you vanished
I told you I would see you but didn't
say how long I would remain Baba ji
laughed softly you were full of
excitement I assure you that I was
fairly extinguished in the ether by the
gust of your restlessness I was
instantly satisfied by the Sun flattered
and explanation I knelt at his feet the
supreme guru patted me kindly on the
shoulder child you must meditate more he
said your gaze is not yet faultless you
could not see me hiding behind the
sunlight with these words and the voice
of a celestial fruit Baba ji disappeared
in the hidden radiance that was one of
my last visits to Banaras to see my guru
Sri Yukteswar concluded even as baba ji
had foretold a tacuba Mela the
householder incarnation of Larry Masha
was drawing to a close during the summer
of 1895 his stalwart body developed a
small boil on the back he protested
against lancing he was working out in
his own flesh the evil karma of
someone's disciples finally a few
cheetahs became very insistent the
master replied cryptically the body has
a fine to cause to go I will be
agreeable to whatever you want to do a
short time later the incomparable Guru
gave up his body in Banaras no longer
need I seek him out in his little
parlour I find him every day of my life
blessed by his omnipresent guidance
years later from the lips of Swami Ke$ha
banan de an advanced disciple I heard
many wonderful details about the passing
of Larry Masha a few days before my guru
relinquished his body
Keshav Ananda told me he materialized
himself before me as I sat in my
Hermitage at Hardwar come at once to
Banaras with the words Larry Masha
vanished
i entrained immediately for Banaras and
my gurus home I found many disciples
assembled for hours that day the master
expound the Gita then he had dressed us
simply I am going home sobs of anguish
broke out like irresistible torrent be
comforted I shall arise again after this
utterance Larry Mara thrice turned his
body around in a circle faced the north
and his Lotus posture and gloriously
entered the final maja Samadhi
Larry Mosher's beautiful body so dear to
the devotees was cremated with solemn
householder rights at Manikarnika Ghat
by the old holy Ganges kasib ananda
continued the following day at 10
o'clock in the morning while I was still
in Banaras my room was suffused with a
great light low before stood me the
flesh and blood form of Larry Masha it
looked exactly like his old body except
that it appeared younger and more
radiant my divine guru spoke to me
ketchup Ananda he said it is I from the
disintegrator atoms of my created body I
have resurrected a remodeled form my
householder work in the world is done
but I do not leave the into Earth
entirely henceforth I shall spend some
time with Baba ji in the Himalayas and
with baba ji in the cosmos with a few
words of blessing to me the transcendent
master vanish wondrous inspiration
filled my heart I was uplifted in spirit
even as were the disciples of Christ and
Kabir when they gazed on the living
gurus after physical death when I
returned to my isolated hardware
Hermitage Kashyap Ananda went on I
carried with me the sacred ashes of my
guru I know he has escaped the
spatiotemporal cage the bird of
omnipresence is free yet it comforted my
heart to enshrine his sacred remains
another disciple who was blessed by the
sight of his resurrected guru was a
saintly pension on Bhattacharya
founder of the Calcutta re-emission
institution I visited pan Chanin on his
Calcutta home
and listen with the light to the story
of as many years of the master in
conclusion he told me the most marvelous
event in his life here in Calcutta pan
Chanin said at 10 o'clock in the morning
which followed his cremation Larry Masha
appeared before me in living glory swami
prabhavananda
the saint with two bodies also confided
to me the details was own supernal
experience a few days before larry masha
left his body Pranab ananda told me the
time he visited my Ranchi school I
received a letter from him requesting me
to come at once to Banaras I was delayed
however and could not leave immediately
as I was in the midst of my travel
preparations about 10 o'clock in the
morning I was suddenly overwhelmed with
joy to see the shining figure of my guru
why hurry to Banaras Larry Masha said
smiling you shall find me there no
longer as the import of his words dawned
on me I saw broken heartedly believing
that I was seeing him only in a vision
the master approached me comfortably
here touch my flesh he said I am living
as always do not lament am I not with
you forever from the lips of these three
great disciples a story of wondrous
truth is emerged at the morning hour of
10:00 on the day after the body of Larry
Moss had been consigned to the flames
the resurrected master in a real but
transfigured body appeared before three
disciples each one in a different City
so when this corruptible shall have put
on incorruption and this mortal shall
have put on immortality then shall be
brought to pass the saying that is
written death is swallowed up in victory
Oh death where is thy sting o grave
where is thy victory end of chapter
